class.description: Object that transfers data between a web client and a remote web server.

constructor.description: Creates a new instance of an XMLHttpRequest object.

property.name: onreadystatechange
property.description: Event handler that fires when readystate changes value. Default is null.

property.name: readyState
property.description: Returns the current state of an object. Valid values are 0=uninitialized, 1=open, 2=sent, 3=receiving, 4=loaded.

property.name: responseText
property.description: Response formatted as a string.

property.name: responseXML
property.description: Response formatted as an XML document.

property.name: status
property.description: Status of the Response. (e.g. 200="OK", 404="Not Found", etc.)

property.name: statusText
property.description: Response text corresonding to status (e.g. "OK", "Not Found", etc.)

method.name: abort
method.description: Cancels the current request.
method.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

method.name: getAllResponseHeaders
method.description: Returns all HTTP headers as a single string.
method.return-description: Returns all HTTP headers as a single string.
method.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

method.name: getResponseHeader
method.description: Returns the value of the specified HTTP header.
method.return-description: Returns the value of the specified HTTP header.

parameter.name: header
parameter.description: Name of the HTTP header.

method.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

method.name: open
method.description: Initializes the request with the specified parameters.

parameter.name: method
parameter.description: Name of the HTTP method. Specify a value of GET, POST, HEAD, or PUT.

parameter.name: uri
parameter.description: Complete URI or relative URI that can be resolved to a complete URI.

parameter.name: async
parameter.description: If true, specifies that the request should be handled asyncrhonously.

parameter.name: user
parameter.description: Username to send in the request.

parameter.name: password
parameter.description: Password to send in the request.

method.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

method.name: send
method.description: Sends the request.

parameter.name: data
parameter.description: Data (content) to send for the request. Can be a String or an XML Document.

exception.description: Throws an INVALID_STATE_ERR error if the send method is called when readyState has an inappropriate value.

method.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

method.name: setRequestHeader
method.description: Sets a header and a value for the request.

parameter.name: header
parameter.description: Name of the header.

parameter.name: value
parameter.description: Value of the header.

exception.description: Throws an UNKNOWN_ERR error.

method.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

class.remarks: Although currently recognized by most browsers, the XMLHttpRequest object will be part of the HTML DOM Level 3 specification.

class.description: Provides contextual information associated with User Interface-related events.

constructor.description: Provides contextual information associated with User Interface-related events.

property.name: detail
property.description: Numeric detail related to the event.

browser.description: Incorrect on Windows.

property.example:
For examples, see the quirksmode test page:

http://www.quirksmode.org/js/events/detail.html

property.name: view
property.description: Window that generated the event.

method.name: initUIEvent

parameter.name: typeArg
parameter.description: Type of event.

parameter.name: canBubbleArg
parameter.description: If true, the event should bubble by default.

parameter.name: cancelableArg
parameter.description: If true, the event is cancellable by default.

parameter.name: viewArg
parameter.description: Window or frame for the event.

parameter.name: detailArg
parameter.description: Code for the event detail.

method.description: Sets the initial property values for a new UIEvent object.

class.description: Represents a CSS view.

constructor.description: Represents a CSS view.

class.description: Reference to the inline CSS style for the element. This is an internal convenience object to allow access to the CSS style properties, and cannot be instantiated directly. It will disappear in future revisions.

constructor.description: Reference to the inline CSS style for the element.

property.name: accelerator
property.description: Specifies whether or not the element has an accelerator key, which is a shortcut for selecting the element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: azimuth
property.description: Specifies the speaker balance for audio content.
property.remarks: To specify an angle, use syntax similar to "90deg".

property.name: background
property.description: Defines the background properties for an element.
property.remarks: Use the background property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual background properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a background- property as part of background.
property.example: To specify a background image in an "images" directory named myCat.jpg that repeats vertically, use the following syntax: body {background: url(images/myCat.jpg), repeat-y}.

property.name: backgroundAttachment
property.description: Specifies whether or not the background image is fixed or scrollable as a user scrolls the document.

property.name: backgroundColor
property.description: Specifies the background color for the element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: backgroundImage
property.description: Specifies the URL for a background image for an element.
property.example: To specify a background image in an "images" directory named myCat.jpg, use the following syntax: body {background-image: url(images/myCat.jpg)}.

property.name: backgroundPosition
property.description: Specifies the position of a background image for an element.
property.remarks: If you do not specify one or more of the values top, center, bottom, left, or right, you also specify absolute pixel values or percentage values.

property.name: backgroundPositionX
property.description: Specifies the x-position of a background image for an element.
property.hint: [length | percentage | horziontal-alignment]. Example values: 50px 50px, 10% 5%, 2cm 4cm, 2cm 5%, center, etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: backgroundPositionY
property.description: Specifies the y-position of a background image for an element.
property.hint: [length | percentage | vertical-alignment]. Example values: 50px 50px, 10% 5%, 2cm 4cm, 2cm 5%, center, etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: backgroundRepeat
property.description: Specifies how a background image repeats for an element.

property.name: border
property.description: Defines the border properties for an element.
property.remarks: Use the border property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border- property as part of border.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed border, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border: thick red dashed;}.

property.name: borderBottom
property.description: Defines the properties for the bottom border for the element.
property.remarks: Use the border-bottom property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-bottom properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-bottom- property as part of border-bottom.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed bottom border, use the following syntax: .myborderbottomclass {border-bottom: thick red dashed;}.

property.name: borderBottomColor
property.description: Specifies the color for a bottom border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: borderBottomStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for a bottom border.

property.name: borderBottomWidth
property.description: Specifies the width of the bottom border.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-bottom-width.

property.name: borderCollapse
property.description: Specifies whether the borders for an element are collapsed or separated.

property.name: borderColor
property.description: Specifies the color for the borders for an element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: borderLeft
property.description: Defines the properties for the left border for the element.
property.remarks: Use the border-left property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-left properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-left- property as part of border-left.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed left border, use the following syntax: .myborderleftclass {border-left: thick red dashed;}.

property.name: borderLeftColor
property.description: Specifies the color for a left border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: borderLeftStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for a left border.

property.name: borderLeftWidth
property.description: Specifies the width of the left border.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-left-width.

property.name: borderRight
property.description: Defines the properties for the right border for the element.
property.remarks: Use the border-right property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-right properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-right- property as part of border-right.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed right border, use the following syntax: .myborderrightclass {border-right: thick red dashed;}.

property.name: borderRightColor
property.description: Specifies the color for a right border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: borderRightStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for a right border.

property.name: borderRightWidth
property.description: Specifies the width of the right border.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-right-width.

property.name: borderSpacing
property.description: Specifies the number of pixels between the border and its contents.
property.remarks: To specify different values for horizontal and vertical spacing, specify two values with the horizontal value first.
property.example: To specify 6px of space on the sides and 12px of spacing above and below and element, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-spacing: 6px 12px;}.

property.name: borderStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for a border.
property.remarks:
Use the border-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-style properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-style- property as part of border-style.

You can specify up to four different border styles for the border of an element.

  • For border that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For border that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For border that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For border with four different styles, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
property.example: To specify a border style that is solid on top, ridged on the right and bottom, and solid on the left, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-style: solid ridged ridged solid;}.

property.name: borderTop
property.description: Defines the properties for the top border for the element.
property.remarks: Use the border-top property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual border-top properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-top- property as part of border-top.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed top border, use the following syntax: .mybordertopclass {border-top: thick red dashed;}.

property.name: borderTopColor
property.description: Specifies the color for a top border. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: borderTopStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for a top border.

property.name: borderTopWidth
property.description: Specifies the width of the top border.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-top-width.

property.name: borderWidth
property.description: Specifies the width of the border.
property.remarks:
You can also specify a fixed pixel value for border-width.

You can specify up to four different widths for the border of an element.

  • For border that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For border that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For border that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For border with four different styles, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
property.example: To specify a border width that is 2px on top, 1px on the right and bottom, and 2px on the left, use the following syntax: .myborderclass {border-width: 2px 1px 1px 2px;}.

property.name: bottom
property.description: Specifies the y-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the bottom edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for bottom.

property.name: captionSide
property.description: Specifies the position of a caption for the element.

property.name: clear
property.description: Specifies the position of the element relative to a floating object on the page.

property.name: clip
property.description: Specifies the x- and y-coordinates (in pixels) for the clipping rectangle around the element.
property.hint: [rect(top-value right-value bottom-value left-value)]. Example values: rect(10px 25px 25px 10px).

property.name: color
property.description: Specifies the color of the text for the element. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: content
property.description: Specifies the content to insert before or after the element.
property.hint: [url(image-url) | quote-style-value]. Example values: url(images/bluestar.gif), "Chapter: ", open-quote, etc.
property.remarks: Use content to specify either a quote style or an image to use (similar to a bullet) before or after an element.
property.example: To specify that a paragraph should have an image from an "images" directory called "bluestar.gif" before it use the following syntax: p:before {content: url(images/bluestar.gif);}.

property.name: counterIncrement
property.description: Specifies a name of a counter and how much to increment the counter by.
property.hint: [counter-name] [increment]. Example values: countby2 2, chapter, countbackwards -1, etc.
property.remarks: Use the counter-increment property for styles such as numbered headings.
property.example: To specify a level-1 section heading with an incremented Roman numeral before each heading, use the following syntax: H1:before {counter(section, upper-roman); counter-increment: section;}.

property.name: counterReset
property.description: Resets a counter to the specified value.
property.example: To specify a level-1 section heading with an incremented Roman numeral before each heading and that sets a counter called "section" to "1" each time it occurs, use the following syntax: H1:before {counter(chapter, upper-roman); counter-increment: section; counter-reset section 1;}.

property.name: cue
property.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue before or after an element.
property.remarks: Use the cue property as a shortcut to typing out both the cue-before and cue-after properties separately.
property.example: To specify a sound file named "bell.wav" before an H1 element and a sound file named "horns.wav", use the following syntax: H1 {cue: url("bell.wav") url("horns.wav");}.

property.name: cueBefore
property.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue before an element.
property.example: To specify a sound file named "bell.wav" before an H1 element, use the following syntax: H1 {cue-before: url("bell.wav");}.

property.name: cueAfter
property.description: Defines the properties for an aural cue after an element.
property.example: To specify a sound file named "horns.wav" after an H1 element, use the following syntax: H1 {cue: url("horns.wav");}.

property.name: cursor
property.description: Specifies which cursor to display when a user mouses over the element.
property.hint: [cursor-value | url(cursor-url)]. Example values: url(mycursor.cur), hand, etc.

property.name: direction
property.description: Specifies the text direction for the element.

property.name: display
property.description: Specifies how to display the element.

property.name: elevation
property.description: Specifies the elevation of the element. You can either one of the relative elevations or specify an angle in degrees.
property.remarks: To specify an angle, use syntax similar to "90deg".

property.name: emptyCells
property.description: Specifies whether to show or hide borders for empty table cells.

property.name: filter
property.description: Specifies a filter for the element to render and any parameters that the filter takes. You can specify multiple filters.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: float
property.description: Specifies if an element should float towards the left or right margin of its parent element or web browser.

property.name: font
property.description: Defines the properties for the font for the element.
property.remarks: Use the font property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual font properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a font property as part of font.

property.name: fontFamily
property.description: Specifies the font face for the element.
property.hint: Example values: monospace, "Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif", Helvetica, etc.

property.name: fontSize
property.description: Specifies either the explicit or relative size of the font compared to the base font size.
property.remarks: You can explicitly specify a font size for font-size in either pixels or a percentage.

property.name: fontSizeAdjust
property.description: Specifies the adjustment to make in font size if an explicitly specified font is unavailable.

property.name: fontStretch
property.description: Specifies how a font should be condensed or stretched.

property.name: fontStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for a font (e.g. italic).

property.name: fontVariant
property.description: Specifies a variation for a font (e.g. small-caps).

property.name: fontWeight
property.description: Specifies the weight of a font (e.g. bold).

property.name: height
property.description: Specifies the height (in pixels, points, or as a percentage) of the content of the element.
property.remarks: height does not include the margins, padding, or borders of an element.

property.name: imeMode
property.description: Specifies the state of the Input Method Editor (IME) for the element, which allows users to enter and edit Chinese, Japanese, and Korean characters.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: layoutFlow
property.description: Specifies the flow direction for the content of the element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: layoutGrid
property.description: Defines the set of layout-grid properties for an element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: layoutGridChar
property.description: Specifies the size of a character grid for the content of an element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: layoutGridLine
property.description: Specifies the grid line value for the text content of an element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: layoutGridMode
property.description: Specifies if the element text layout grid uses the line and/or char mode.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: layoutGridType
property.description: Specifies the type of layout grid for the content of an element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: left
property.description: Specifies the x-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the left edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for left.

property.name: letterSpacing
property.description: Specifies the amount of space (in points or pixels) between letters in the text of the element.

property.name: lineBreak
property.description: Specifies line-breaking rules for Japanese text.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: lineHeight
property.description: Specifies line height of text in multiline elements, such as paragraphs.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for line-height.

property.name: listStyle
property.description: Defines the properties for the list style for a list element.
property.remarks: Use the list-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual list-style properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a list-style property as part of list-style.
property.example: To specify an unordered list with a square bullet outside of the list, use the following syntax: ul { list-style: square outside;}.

property.name: listStyleImage
property.description: Specifies the URL to an image to use for list items.
property.example: To specify an unordered list that uses an image called "bluestar.gif" for a bullet, use the following syntax: ul { url(bluestar.gif)}.

property.name: listStylePosition
property.description: Specifies the position of the bullet or number for a list.

property.name: listStyleType
property.description: Specifies the position of the bullet or number for a list.

property.name: margin
property.description: Defines the widths (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the margins for the element.
property.remarks:
Use the margin property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual margin properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a margin property as part of margin.

You can specify up to four different widths for the margin of an element.

  • For a margin that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For a margin that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For a margin that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For a margin with four different widths, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
property.example: To specify a margin that is 10px wide on the top and left and 5px wide on the bottom and right, use the following syntax: body {margin: 10px 5px 5px 10px;}.

property.name: marginBottom
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the bottom margin of an element.

property.name: marginLeft
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the left margin of an element.

property.name: marginRight
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the right margin of an element.

property.name: marginTop
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the top margin of an element.

property.name: markerOffset
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels or points) between the marker box of an element and the surrounding box of its parent element.

property.name: marks
property.description: Specifies if cross or crop marks should appear outside of the element on a printed page.

property.name: maxHeight
property.description: Specifies the maximum height that an element may be.
property.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

property.name: maxWidth
property.description: Specifies the maximum width that an element may be.
property.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

property.name: minHeight
property.description: Specifies the minimum height that an element may be.
property.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

property.name: minWidth
property.description: Specifies the minimum width that an element may be.
property.remarks: This property is useful for elements that are relatively sized compared to a browser window or parent element.

property.name: mozBinding
property.description: Specifies the URL of an XBL file to bind to the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozBorderRadius
property.description: Specifies the radius of the border around the element.
property.remarks:
Use the border-style property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual -moz-border-radius properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a border-style- property as part of border-style.

You can specify up to four different border styles for the border of an element.

  • For a border radius that is the same on all four corners, specify a single value.
  • For a border radius that is different on the top-left/bottom-right and top-right/bottom-left corners, specify two values with the top-left/bottom-right value first.
  • For a border radius that are different on the top-left, top-rightright/bottom-left, and bottom-right corners, specify three values in the order of top-left, top-rightright/bottom-left, and bottom-right.
  • For a border radius with four different corners, specify four values in the order of top-left, top-rightright, bottom-right, and bottom-left.

property.name: mozBorderRadiusBottomLeft
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the bottom-left corner of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozBorderRadiusBottomRight
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the bottom-right corner of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozBorderRadiusTopLeft
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the top-left corner of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozBorderRadiusTopRight
property.description: Specifies the border radius of the top-right corner of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozBorderTopColors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the top border of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: mozBorderRightColors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the right border of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: mozBorderBottomColors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the bottom border of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: mozBorderLeftColors
property.description: Specifies one or more colors to use in a striping effect on the left border of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: mozOpacity
property.description: Specifies the level of opacity for the element. Use a two-digit decimal.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.
property.hint: [0-1.0] 0 is completely transparent, while 1.0 is completely solid.

property.name: mozOutline
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline property. Defines the properties for an outline drawn over the outer edge of an element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozOutlineColor
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-color property that specifies the color for an outline. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozOutlineStyle
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-style property that specifies a style for an outline.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozOutlineWidth
property.description: Mozilla-specific version of the outline-width property that specifies the width of the outline.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozUserFocus
property.description: Specifies the behavior of the element when it receives focus.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozUserInput
property.description: Specifies whether or not the element has input focus.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozUserModify
property.description: Specifies if a user can change the contents of the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: mozUserSelect
property.description: Specifies the content selection behavior for the element.
property.remarks: Proprietary Mozilla property.

property.name: oLink
property.description: Specifies the value for the link variable.
property.remarks: Opera only.

property.name: oLinkSource
property.description: Specifies the source anchor for the element.
property.remarks: Opera only.

property.name: orphans
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of lines of text that an element must have left at the bottom of a page for printing.

property.name: outline
property.description: Defines the properties for an outline drawn over the outer edge of an element. Outlines differ from borders in that borders are drawn to the outside of the element.
property.remarks: Use the outline property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual outline properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a outline property as part of outline.
property.example: To specify a thick, red, dashed outline, use the following syntax: .myoutlineclass {outline: thick red dashed;}.

property.name: outlineColor
property.description: Specifies the color for an outline. Specify either a color name or RGB color code.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.

property.name: outlineStyle
property.description: Specifies a style for an outline.

property.name: outlineWidth
property.description: Specifies the width of the outline.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel value for outline-width.

property.name: overflow
property.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content does not fit within the predefined boundaries of the element.

property.name: overflowX
property.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content is too wide for the element.

property.name: overflowY
property.description: Specifies how to handle content overflow of an element if the content is too tall for the element.

property.name: padding
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding space between the content of an element and its border.
property.remarks:
Use the padding property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual padding properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a padding property as part of padding.

You can specify up to four different widths for the amound of padding for an element.

  • For padding that is the same on all four sides, specify a single value.
  • For padding that is different on the top/bottom and left/right sides, specify two values with the top/bottom value first.
  • For padding that is different on the top, left/right, and bottom sides, specify three values with the top value first, followed by the left/right and then bottom values.
  • For padding with four different widths, specify four values in the order of top, right, bottom, and left.
property.example: To specify a padding that is 10px wide on the top and left and 5px wide on the bottom and right, use the following syntax: body {padding: 10px 5px 5px 10px;}.

property.name: paddingBottom
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) at the bottom of an element.

property.name: paddingLeft
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the left side of an element.

property.name: paddingRight
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) for the right side of an element.

property.name: paddingTop
property.description: Specifies the amount of padding (in pixels, points, or a percentage) at the top of an element.

property.name: page
property.description: Specifies the type of page that the element should be displayed on.

property.name: pageBreakAfter
property.description: Defines the way that a page breaks after the element when the page is printed.

property.name: pageBreakBefore
property.description: Defines the way that a page breaks before the element when the page is printed.

property.name: pageBreakInside
property.description: Specifies if an element should have a page break forced inside of the element or if page breaks should be avoided inside the element when the page is printed.

property.name: pause
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause before and/or after an element before playing audio content.
property.remarks: Use the pause property as a shortcut to typing out all of the individual pause properties separately. You can specify any valid value for a pause property as part of pause.

property.name: pauseAfter
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause after an element before playing audio content.

property.name: pauseBefore
property.description: Specifies the number of seconds or milliseconds to pause before an element before playing audio content.

property.name: pitch
property.description: Specifies the frequency of a speaking voice for audio content.

property.name: pitchRange
property.description: Specifies the range of the pitch of a speaking voice for audio content.

property.name: playDuring
property.description: Specifies a sound to play while the content of the element is being spoken.

property.name: position
property.description: Specifies how the element is positioned relative to the page or other elements.

property.name: quotes
property.description: Specifies the style of quotation marks to use for embedded quotes.

property.name: richness
property.description: Specifies the richness of the speaking voice for audio content.

property.name: right
property.description: Specifies the x-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the right edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for right.

property.name: rubyAlign
property.description: Specifies the alignment for ruby text.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: rubyOverhang
property.description: Specifies the overhang of ruby text.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: rubyPosition
property.description: Specifies the position of ruby text.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbar3dLightColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and scroll arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarArrowColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the arrow of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarBaseColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the main elements of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarDarkshadowColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the gutter of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarFaceColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarHighlightColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the top and left edges of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarShadowColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the bottom and right edges of the scroll box and arrows of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: scrollbarTrackColor
property.description: Specifies the color of the track element of a scroll bar.
property.hint: [color | "transparent"]. Example values: Red, #FF0000 (#RRGGBB color code for "red"), etc.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: size
property.description: Specifies the size and orientation of a page for print output.
property.hint: [width] [height] [size-value]. Example values: 8.5in 10in portrait, 14 in 10 in, landscape, etc.
property.example: To specify an 10x8 inch page that prints as landscape, use the following syntax: body {size: landscape 10in 8in;}.

property.name: speak
property.description: Specifies how the content will be rendered as audio content.

property.name: speak-header
property.description: For audio content, specifies whether table headers are spoken before every cell or just once until the header changes.

property.name: speakNumeral
property.description: For audio content, specifies whether numerals are spoken as individual digits or continuous numbers.

property.name: speakPunctuation
property.description: For audio content, specifies whether punctuation characters will be spoken or read as pauses.

property.name: speechRate
property.description: For audio content, specifies the speaking rate.

property.name: stress
property.description: For audio content, specifies the number of inflection points in the voice.

property.name: tableLayout
property.description: Specifies whether the layout of table rows, columns, and cells is fixed.

property.name: textAlign
property.description: Specifies the horizontal alignment property for the element.

property.name: textAlignLast
property.description: Specifies the alignment for the last or only line of text for the element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: textDecoration
property.description: Specifies a text decoration for the element.

property.name: textIndent
property.description: Specifies the amount (in pixels, points, or a percentage) that the first line of text should be indented in a block of content.

property.name: textJustify
property.description: Specifies the alignment to use to justify the text for the element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: textOverflow
property.description: Specifies whether to use ellipses (...) to indicate text overflow.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: textShadow
property.description: Defines the horizontal depth, vertical depth, blur, and color for a drop-shadow for text content in the element.
property.remarks: Specify the color before or after the depth and blur values. The first depth value corresponds to the number of pixels the shandow extends to the right. The second depth value corresponds to the number of pixels the shadow extends below the text. A third value corresponds to blur.
property.example: To specify a blue 5 pixel drop-shadow with a 5 pixel blur, use the following syntax: H1 {text-shadow: 5px 5px 5px blue;}.

property.name: textTransform
property.description: Specifies that the text for the element should be converted to the assigned case or format.

property.name: textUnderlinePosition
property.description: Specifies the position of the underline text-decoration.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: top
property.description: Specifies the y-coordinate for the position of the element relative to the top edge of the parent element or browser window.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for top.

property.name: unicodeBidi
property.description: Specifies that the text direction in the element may be overriden for multi-language support.

property.name: verticalAlign
property.description: Specifies the vertical alignment property for the element.
property.remarks: You can also specify a fixed pixel or percentage value for vertical-align.

property.name: visibility
property.description: Specifies whether an element is visible or hidden.

property.name: voiceFamily
property.description: Specifies the speaking voice for audio content.
property.hint: [voice-name | voice-family-value]. Example values: george, robot, male, etc.
property.remarks: You can specify a specific voice name and/or a male, female, or child voice.

property.name: volume
property.description: Specifies the sound volume for audio content.
property.hint: [0-100 | percentage | volume-value]. Example values: 25, 30%, soft, etc.
property.remarks: You can specify a number from 0-100 or a percentage to set the volume for this property.

property.name: whiteSpace
property.description: Specifies how to handle white space characters for the element.

property.name: widows
property.description: Specifies the minimum number of lines of text that an element must have left at the top of a page for printing.

property.name: width
property.description: Specifies the width (in pixels, points, or as a percentage) of the content of the element.
property.remarks: width does not include the margins, padding, or borders of an element.

property.name: wordBreak
property.description: Specifies line-breaking behavior between words in the content of the element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: wordSpacing
property.description: Specifies the amount of space between words for the element text.

property.name: wordWrap
property.description: Specifies line-breaking behavior for words that are longer than their container boundaries.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: writingMode
property.description: Specifies the direction and flow of content in the element.
property.remarks: IE only.

property.name: zIndex
property.description: Specifies the stacking order of the element relative to other layers. A higher z-index value will place the element above layers with lower z-index values.

property.name: zoom
property.description: Specifies the magnification scale for the element.

class.description: Force a line break.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLBRElement.

property.name: clear
property.description: Control flow of text around floats.

class.description: Generic block container.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLDivElement.

property.name: align
property.description: Horizontal text alignment.

class.description: Definition List.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLDListElement.

property.name: compact
property.description: Reduce spacing between list items.

class.description: For the H1 to H6 elements.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLHeadingElement.

property.name: align
property.description: Horizontal text alignment.

class.description: Create a horizontal rule.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLHRElement.

property.name: align
property.description: Align the rule on the page.

property.name: noShade
property.description: Indicates to the user agent that there should be no shading in the rendering of this element.

property.name: size
property.description: The height of the rule.

property.name: width
property.description: The width of the rule.

class.description: Root of an HTML document.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLhtmlElement.

property.name: version
property.description: Version information about the document's DTD.

class.description: Specifies an element for paragraphs.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLParagraphElement.

property.name: align
property.description: Horizontal line alignment.

class.description: Preformatted text.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLPreElement.

property.name: width
property.description: Fixed width for content.

class.description: Represents a list of items, where the order of the items is not important.

constructor.description: Creates an instance of the HTMLUListElement.

property.name: compact
property.description: Reduce spacing between list items.

property.name: type
property.description: The style of the list.
